quotes.quote: The internet could be a very positive step towards education, organisation and participation in a meaningful society.
The Internet is so big, so powerful and pointless that for some people it is a complete substitute for life.

The internet is global and seemingly omniscient, while iPods and phones are all microscopic workings encased in plastic blobjects. Compare that to a steam engine, where you can watch the pistons move and feel the heat of its boilers. I think we miss that visceral appeal of the machine.
One of the internet's strengths is its ability to help consumers find the right needle in a digital haystack of data.
The internet is just a world passing notes around a classroom.
There are no secrets on the internet.
The internet is like alcohol in some sense. It accentuates what you would do anyway. If you want to be a loner, you can be more alone. If you want to connect, it makes it easier to connect.
As a research tool, the internet is invaluable.
Information flow is what the internet is about. Information sharing is power. If you don't share your ideas, smart people can't do anything about them, and you'll remain anonymous and powerless.
Oh, Wikipedia, with your tension between those who would share knowledge and those who would destroy it.
A journey of a thousand sites begins with a single click.
The problem with this generation is that they believe in social media more than people.
The Internet is the most effective instrument we have for globalization.
All I know is that the Internet will transform the world.
I guess the internet and the power of people finding things out for themselves is great.
We are all now connected by the internet, like neurons in a giant brain.
The Internet provides a delivery system for pathological states of mind.
The internet changes the structure of society all the time this massiveness made of individuals.
The Internet can empower groups whose aims are in fact antithetical to democracy.
The internet is a telephone system that's gotten uppity.
The internet was crucial for our success. It is a great thing. It is a big democracy because people can choose what they like.
The internet is the most powerful magnifier of slack ever invented.
The Internet isn't free. It just has an economy that makes no sense to capitalism.
The Internet is the first thing that humanity has built that humanity doesn't understand, the largest experiment in anarchy that we have ever had.
The internet is a giant international network of intelligent, informed computer enthusiasts, by which I mean, people without lives. We don't care. We have each other.
A lot of things you want to do as part of daily life can now be done over the Internet.
Just move to the Internet, its great here. We get to live inside where the weather is always awesome.
Like most technology, the internet has mixed effects. It's a neutral instrument.
The internet is an Ã©lite organization; most of the population of the world has never even made a phone call.
You can't trust the internet.
Google can bring you back 100,000 answers. A librarian can bring you back the right one.
The internet are the ultimate enemy of unconditional commitment.
Only on the Internet can a person be lonely and popular at the same time.
The only hope we have is the internet. We must strive to keep it free.
The internet has been the most fundamental change during my lifetime and for hundreds of years.
The secret of the Internet's success has been its openness to new services.
Prior to the internet, the last technology that had any real effect on the way people sat down and talked together was the table.
The internet is like a vault with a screen door on the back. I don't need jackhammers and atom bomb to get in when I can walk through the door.
The younger generation is surrounded by the Internet, apps, and video games. But somehow, my books make them read.
You know, the Internets made us more aware of what people think about us.
A few years ago, users of Internet services began to realize that when an online service is free, you're not the customer. You're the product.
The Internet of things will augment your brain.
The internet is the great highway of the modern communication, free and independent.
The Internet is the most important single development in the history of human communication since the invention of call waiting.
The internet is becoming the town square for the global village of tomorrow.
The Internet is the crime scene of the 21st Century.
The nature of the internet is that you don't know who is behind the screen.
The internet interprets censorship as damage and routes around it.
The internet is by the people, for the people.
Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.
To join in the industrial revolution, you needed to open a factory; in the Internet revolution, you need to open a laptop.
The internet is a great way to get on the net.
If you think that the internet has changed your life, think again. The Internet of Things is about to change it all over again!
Some say the Internet is for porn but you know that in truth the Internet is for spam.
The Internet is for lonely people. People should live.
I have an almost religious zeal, not for technology per se, but for the Internet which is for me, the nervous system of mother Earth, which I see as a living.
The Internet, transforming society and shaping the future through chat.
If television's a babysitter, the Internet is a drunk librarian who won't shut up.
Privacy is not an option, and it shouldn't be the price we accept for just getting on the Internet.
As the Internet of things advances, the very notion of a clear dividing line between reality and virtual reality becomes blurred, sometimes in creative ways.
The internet has been a boon and a curse for teenagers.
Access to computers and the Internet has become a basic need for education in our society.
It's been my policy to view the Internet not as an 'information highway, but as an electronic asylum filled with babbling loonies.
Over half of the internet is a dump for useless information.
The internet is not for sissies.
The internet always proving that you're not quite as special as you suspected.
Doing research on the Web is like using a library assembled piecemeal by pack rats and vandalized nightly.
There was a time when people felt the internet was another world, but now people realise it's a tool that we use in this world.
People live too much of their lives on email or the Internet or text messages these days. We're losing all of our communication skills.
The problem with the Internet is that it gives you everything reliable material and crazy material. So the problem becomes, how do you discriminate?
